name: SMT-Lite Integer Constraint Solver
description: Solves Satisfiability Modulo Theories constraints combining boolean logic with integer linear arithmetic
when_to_use: Integer linear programming with boolean constraints
Program verification with integer variables and assertions
Scheduling with integer time slots and constraints
Hardware verification with bit-vectors and integer logic
when_not_to_use: Pure SAT problems without arithmetic (use DPLL SAT)
Nonlinear integer problems (NP-hard, may be unsolvable)
Problems requiring symbolic reasoning beyond integer arithmetic

complexity.time: NP-hard for full SMT(LIA); depends on theory and formula structure
complexity.space: O(variables + constraints) for maintaining solver state

parameters.name: objective
parameters.description: Optional: minimize or maximize objective function

parameters.name: theory
parameters.description: LIA (Linear Integer Arithmetic) or QF_BV (Quantifier-free Bit-Vector)

use_cases: Test case generation for program paths
embedding_text: SMT solvers decide satisfiability of formulas in Satisfiability Modulo Theories. SMT(LIA) handles linear integer arithmetic over booleans. Combines SAT solving with theory-specific decision procedures. Key component of formal verification tools. Handles assertions like (x > 5 AND y <= 2x) AND (flag OR NOT constraint). Exponential worst-case but effective with heuristics.
